title: Seafarers) Regulations 2014 (S.I. No. 242 of 2014), as amended by the European
heading: 2. The European Union (Training, Certification and Watchkeeping for
text_raw:
2. The European Union (Training, Certification and Watchkeeping for 
Seafarers) Regulations 2014 (S.I. No. 242 of 2014), as amended by the European 
Union (Training, Certification and Watchkeeping for Seafarers) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 454 of 2021), are amended – 

(a) 

in Regulation 2(1), by substituting for the definition of 
“Directive” the following: 

“‘Directive’ means Directive (EU) 2022/993 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 8 June 20221; 

‘Directive of 2008’ means Directive 2008/106/EC of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 19 November 20082 
the European 
(as amended by Directive 2012/35/EU of 
Parliament and of the Council of 21 November 20123, and 
Directive (EU) 2019/1159 of the European Parliament and of the 
Council of 20 June 20194);”, 

(b) 

in Regulation 2, by substituting paragraph (3) with the following: 

“(3) In these Regulations a reference – 

(a) 

(b) 

to an Article is a reference to an Article of the 
Directive of 2008, which shall be construed as an 
Article of the Directive, in accordance with the 
correlation table in Annex V to the Directive, 

to an Annex is a reference to an Annex to the 
Directive of 2008, which shall be construed as an 
Annex to the Directive, in accordance with the 
correlation table in Annex V to the Directive, 

1 OJ No. L 169, 27.6.2022, p. 45 
2 OJ No. L 323, 3.12.2008, p.33 
3 OJ No. L 343, 14.12.2012, p.78 
4 OJ No. L 188, 12.7.2019, p.94 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 7th March, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [60] 3 

(c) 

to a Chapter is a reference to a Chapter of Annex 

I, and 

(d) 

to Part A is a reference to Part A of the code.”, 

(c) 

by deleting Regulation 31, and 

(d) 

in Schedule 3 – 

(i) 

in the third entry, relating to Drogheda, in column (3) by 
substituting for: 

“In winter: 

No partially smooth waters” 

the following: 

“In winter: 

In favourable weather only, within a radius of 1.3 
nautical miles from the eastern tip of the north 
breakwater and terminating at the northern and 
southern foreshores respectively for vessels engaged 
in dredging operations only”, and 

(ii) 

in the seventh entry, relating to Howth Sound, by 
substituting for the matter in column (3), the following: 

“Within a line from the North end of Eastern 
Breakwater to Thulla and south of a line drawn 
westward from Steer Rock”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

5 March, 2025. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 
Minister for Transport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [60]

title: Seafarers) Regulations 2014 (S.I. No. 242 of 2014), as amended by the European
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the European Union (Training, Certification and 
Watchkeeping for Seafarers) Regulations 2014 (S.I. No. 242 of 2014), as 
amended, in relation to: 

(a) 

the references to Directive 2008/106/EC, as amended, which has 
been codified and repealed by Directive (EU) 2022/993, 

(b) 

the transitional provisions, which are no longer relevant, and 

(c) Schedule 3, as inserted by the European Union (Training, 
Certification and Watchkeeping for Seafarers) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 454 of 2021), regarding the 
descriptions of the areas of partially smooth waters in Drogheda 
and Howth Sound, respectively. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [60] 5
